author: pintbeerhouse
title: BeerHouse.io
description: Today has only two ways to view your portfolio, technical sites like cardanoscan or using wallets like yoroi (not recommended for view only)

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal has the problem stated that "only two ways to view your portfolio, technical sites like cardanoscan or using wallets like yoroi". The solution proposed is "The portfolio Manager and Tracker...". Visiting the demo on their website opens a pretty nice Dashboard with a view of tokens and pricing on the Cardano chain in a wallet.
__________________________________________________
The Challenge brief is seeking scaling solutions for the chain, e.g Hydra add on's, Research into scaling solutions, novel scaling solutions, with specific topic areas mentioned: Rollups, Sharding, Sidechains, State Channels.
____________________________________________________
The proposal does not address the Campaign Brief. It is my advice this proposal would better fit the Dapps & Integration or the Developer Challenge on a re-proposal in the next fund.
f6_assessments.q1: In this Challenge this proposal does not address the problem so I do not believe it will be successful. My advice is to re-submit the proposal in F9 to a correct category. From visiting the demo web project I would say it is a Dashboard I would use. I think it would have a good chance of success in the correct challenge and would love to review it when resubmitted. I would hope this would be developed as an open source project for the community if community  funded.
f6_assessments.q2:
I attempted to separate the proposal from this specific challenge and assess the Auditability / Clarity portion on its own merits. 
__________________________________________________
The proposal directs the reader to a web that has a roadmap and tokenomics for a larger project. It did not have the information for this project. The budget detail/explanation has the following statement "The proposed amount will be used to pay the dedicated development team for the next 6 months". There are no KPIs included.
___________________________________________________
As stated in an above section this could be a useful dashboard. It appears the project is fairly well along and almost complete. Should you decide to submit this in F9 I would suggest you are more detailed in your KPIs, your roadmap for this project, Team involved, their skillset and much more detailed on your budget.

f6_assessments.q0:
Draft proposal. There is no clarity in the relationship between this proposal and the challenge. The suggested solution could improve the Cardano user experience by bringing information more easily with portfolio tracking, but this does not make it clear how it will address scalability in Cardano.

There are no clear deliverables and KPIs that allow for a proper impact assessment.

I would recommend that the proposer use the following documentation as a reference for writing a new proposal, including items to indicate impact.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a roadmap (https://docs.beerhouse.io/roadmap) with relevant information about deliverables, but it is important to differentiate the roadmap of Beerhouse from the roadmap referring to the proposal that was submitted in IdeaScale. As there is no clarity in the deliverables of this proposal, there is no way to say if the website roadmap comprises the same points as the proposal, this would need more clarity. There is no budget breakdown. Although this project is already under development and there is a beta version (only available for PINT token holders) there is no information about the references for the experiences of the team members described in the proposal or on the website provided.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are no metrics and KPIs, just a mention of: "KPIs are based on the millestones we have to deliver" No milestones were mentioned in this proposal, only on the Beerhouse website and as there is no clarity in the deliverables of this proposal, there is no way to say if the milestones established on the site would all refer to this proposal.

This proposal is still a draft and although the project is already under development, greater clarity is needed in what this proposal will deliver.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal mentions that there are currently only two ways to view the Cardano portfolio, technical sites like Cardanoscan or using wallets like yoroi. The proposed solution is time saving and convenient by using an intelligent safety analysis and monitoring system. Perhaps the proponent didn't update by the suggested edit deadline, so the proposal looks more like an idea than a ready-made plan. Accordingly, although the proposed idea is good, without a specific plan with a clear solution, it is difficult for the community to assess whether the author will solve this problem suitable for the challenge or not.
f6_assessments.q1:
The only good point of the proposal is to provide a link to https://beerhouse.io/ where we can partially understand the author's solution as well as know the proposal's roadmap in 2022. However, funding here has not been broken. The proposal asks for an amount of $15,000 with a single explanation to be used to pay the dedicated development team for 6 months. This makes it difficult for the community to audit because we don't know how many people your team consists of, how their salaries are distributed, for example, how many hours they work, how much they are paid. what are the hours for each position?
The team is also described very briefly, we know that to carry out this project there are 4 positions needed: UX Designer, Golang Developer, Database Engineer, Community Manager. In addition, the team does not provide any references, links, or another kind of living proof.
f6_assessments.q2:
In my opinion, this proposal is poorly described, does not present a plan, does not provide evidence of experience, and the budget is unclear. I want the team to connect KPI milestones and KPI Roadmaps to project spend, specific tasks and tasks that employees have to deliver and when they have to deliver - this analysis will give more clarity on what they're doing. Workload performance and provisioning in line with labor expenditure, by connecting KPIs and budget roadmap milestones, the team can track performance and spending over time
This is a new project proposal that has never been funded before

f6_assessments.q0: Conceptually, this proposal creates a portfolio Manager and Tracker on Cardano Ecossystem, which saves time and is convenient for users. However, your proposed solution is not really complete, not convincing.
f6_assessments.q1:
After going through all the information you provided, I still can't find anything about the team. You mentioned "Development team with over 20 years of experience in java, large experience in golang and databases." You need to provide more information about your team, such as name, work experience, skills, knowledge, link to your profile (linkedin, telegram,...). As you know, the team plays a very important role in the success of a project. I am very sorry.
All the information you provide, including the 3 parts IMPACT, FEASIBILITY, AUDITABILITY, is not really exhaustive. This makes it impossible for me to be certain of the success of the project. I'm sorry.
I think the first thing to do is describe your proposed solution, then identify the risks and challenges that you will encounter during the project implementation. That will be a solid foundation. Next, the budget allocation is also essential, let everyone know how the $ 15,000 will be used. The criteria for evaluating success are also extremely necessary.
f6_assessments.q2:
Based on the little information provided, this project is very difficult to implement. I think you need to provide more information that I mentioned in the previous section. That will make it easier for CAs to track and evaluate.
Looks like this is your first time to contribute a proposal, don't worry, don't give up, let's do it again, let's work together, let's push the Cardano ecosystem forward.

solution:
The portfolio Manager and Tracker on Cardano Ecossystem
Save time and convenience using an intelligent monitoring and analysis system safety
experience: Development team with over 20 years of experience in java. large experience in golang and databases.
